value.title: Move Measures to Another Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to move measures from one table to another table exists in Power BI, However, the process is not familiar for many users. Through my consulting and training work I have explained it to many of my clients. The process is simple and much better than re-creating the measure again and deleting

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. However, if you have a dynamic range of date, and you want to find the previous period of that dynamic selection, then Parallel Period can’t give you the answer. As an example; if the user selected

value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesn’t have the sentiment colors as an option. Sentiment colors make a gauge much more understandable, you can easily find out is the value high, low, or in the mid-range. Fortunately, there is conditional formatting that

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Highlighting the minimum and maximum values in a Power BI matrix

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI, you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module, you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. You then learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, so that others can see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Dynamic Rolling Average with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a dynamic 7 day or 30 day rolling average wiht DAX What-IF parameters with ease. Create a dynmaic dashboard board that provides immedicate insight.   Check me out on Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.
